metadata.description: Name of the Customer
Username for the Virtual Machine
Password for the Virtual Machine
Identifies whether to to use PAYG (on demand licensing) or BYOL license model (where license is purchased separately)
Select the FortiGate image version
The ARM template provides a basic configuration. Additional configuration can be added here.
Virtual Machine size selection - must be F4 or other instance that supports 4 NICs. Optimum VM size selected by default

Deploy FortiGate VMs in an Availability Set or Availability Zones. If Availability Zones deployment is selected but the location does not support Availability Zones an Availability Set will be deployed. If Availability Zones deployment is selected and Availability Zones are available in the location, FortiGate A will be placed in Zone 1, FortiGate B will be placed in Zone 2
Accelerated Networking enables direct connection between the VM and network card. Only available on 2 CPU F/Fs and 4 CPU D/Dsv2, D/Dsv3, E/Esv3, Fsv2, Lsv2, Ms/Mms and Ms/Mmsv2
Public IP for the Load Balancer for inbound and outbound data of the FortiGate VMs
Name of External Load Balancer Public IP address, if no name is provided the default name will be provided. Leave blank if IP does not already exist.
Public IP Resource Group, this value is required if an existing Public IP is selected

Public IP for management of the FortiGate A. This deployment uses a Standard SKU Azure Load Balancer and requires a Standard SKU public IP. Microsoft Azure offers a migration path from a basic to standard SKU public IP. The management IP's for both FortiGate can be set to none. If no alternative internet access is provided, the SDN Connector functionality for dynamic objects will not work.
Name of FortiaGate 000 Public IP address, if no name is provided the default name will be provided. Leave blank if IP does not already exist.
Public IP Resource Group, this value is required if an existing Public IP is selected

Public IP for management of the FortiGate B. This deployment uses a Standard SKU Azure Load Balancer and requires a Standard SKU public IP. Microsoft Azure offers a migration path from a basic to standard SKU public IP. The management IP's for both FortiGate can be set to none. If no alternative internet access is provided, the SDN Connector functionality for both HA failover and dynamic objects will not work.
Name of FortiaGate 001 Public IP address, if no name is provided the default name will be provided. Leave blank if IP does not already exist.
Public IP Resource Group, this value is required if an existing Public IP is selected

Public IP for Route Server. This deployment uses a Standard SKU Azure Load Balancer and requires a Standard SKU public IP. Microsoft Azure offers a migration path from a basic to standard SKU public IP. The management IP's for both FortiGate can be set to none. If no alternative internet access is provided, the SDN Connector functionality for both HA failover and dynamic objects will not work.
Name of Route Server Public IP address, if no name is provided the default name will be provided. Leave blank if IP does not already exist.
Public IP Resource Group, this value is required if an existing Public IP is selected
Identify whether to use a new or existing vnet
Name of the Azure virtual network, required if utilizing an existing VNET. If no name is provided the default name will be the Resource Group Name as the Prefix and '-VNET' as the suffix
Resource Group containing the existing virtual network, leave blank if a new VNET is being utilized
Virtual Network Address prefix
Subnet 1 Name
Subnet 1 Prefix
Subnet 1 start address, 2 consecutive private IPs are required
Subnet 2 Name
Subnet 2 Prefix
Subnet 2 start address, 3 consecutive private IPs are required
Subnet 3 Name
Subnet 3 Prefix
Subnet 3 start address, 2 consecutive private IPs are required
Subnet 4 Name
Subnet 4 Prefix
Subnet 4 start address, 2 consecutive private IPs are required
Subnet 5 Name
Subnet 5 Prefix
Subnet 4 start address, 2 consecutive private IPs are required
Identify whether to use a new or existing Route Server
Name of the Azure Route Server, required if utilizing an existing Route Server. If no name is provided the default name will be the Resource Group Name as the Prefix and '-VNET' as the suffix
Enable Serial Console
Connect to FortiManager
FortiManager IP or DNS name to connect to on port TCP/541
FortiManager serial number to add the deployed FortiGate into the FortiManager
Primary FortiGate BYOL license content
Secondary FortiGate BYOL license content
Primary FortiGate BYOL FortiFlex license token
Secondary FortiGate BYOL FortiFlex license token
By default, the deployment will use Azure Marketplace images. In specific cases, using BYOL custom FortiGate images can be deployed. This requires a reference

variables.fmgCustomData:
[if(equals(parameters('fortiManager'),'yes'),concat('
config system central-management
set type fortimanager
 set fmg ',parameters('fortiManagerIP'),'
set serial-number ', parameters('fortiManagerSerial'), '
end
 config system interface
 edit port1
 append allowaccess fgfm
 end
 config system interface
 edit port2
 append allowaccess fgfm
 end
'),'')]

variables.fgaCustomDataBody:
[concat('config system sdn-connector
edit AzureSDN
set type azure
next
end
config router static
 edit 1
 set gateway ', variables('sn1GatewayIP'), '
 set device port1
 next
 edit 2
 set dst ', parameters('vnetAddressPrefix'), '
 set gateway ', variables('sn2GatewayIP'), '
 set device port2
 next
 edit 3
set dst 168.63.129.16 255.255.255.255
set device port2
 set gateway ', variables ('sn2GatewayIP'), '
 next
edit 4
set dst 168.63.129.16 255.255.255.255
set device port1
 set gateway ', variables ('sn1GatewayIP'), '
 next
 end
 config system probe-response
 set http-probe-value OK
 set mode http-probe
 end
 config system interface
 edit port1
 set mode static
 set ip ', variables('sn1IPfga'), '/', variables('sn1CIDRmask'), '
 set description external
 set allowaccess probe-response
 next
 edit port2
 set mode static
 set ip ', variables('sn2IPfga'), '/', variables('sn2CIDRmask'), '
 set description internal
 set allowaccess probe-response
 next
 edit port3
 set mode static
 set ip ', variables('sn3IPfga'), '/', variables('sn3CIDRmask'), '
 set description hasyncport
 next
 edit port4
 set mode static
 set ip ', variables('sn4IPfga'), '/', variables('sn4CIDRmask'), '
 set description hammgmtport
 set allowaccess ping https ssh ftm
 next
 end
 config system ha
 set group-name AzureHA
 set mode a-p
 set hbdev port3 100
 set session-pickup enable
 set session-pickup-connectionless enable
 set ha-mgmt-status enable
 config ha-mgmt-interfaces
 edit 1
 set interface port4
 set gateway ', variables('sn4GatewayIP'),'
 next
 end
 set override disable
 set priority 255
 set unicast-hb enable
 set unicast-hb-peerip ', variables('sn3IPfgb'), '
 end
', variables('fmgCustomData'), parameters('fortiGateAdditionalCustomData'), '
')]
